questionStem: A 13-year-old girl is brought to the emergency department 30 minutes after she fell off a sailboat into a freshwater lake. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step in management?

choices.A: Admission to the hospital for observation

correctExplanation: Admission for observation is appropriate for nonfatal drowning with any hypoxia or infiltrates.
incorrectExplanation: Antibiotics and other options are not first-line here.

questionStem: A 47-year-old man is brought to the ED 30 minutes after a seizure. He drinks eight to nine beers nightly. His last drink was 28 hours ago. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step?
correctExplanation: Alcohol withdrawal is managed with benzodiazepines.
incorrectExplanation: Other choices are for different scenarios.

questionStem: A 65-year-old man with hypertension and type 2 diabetes has dyspnea, JVD, edema, S3 gallop. Echo shows LVEF 35%. Which medication should be added?
incorrectExplanation: Other options do not provide same mortality benefit.
